revised_title: World Energy Outlook to the Mid-1980s: Alternative Supply Path in the United States
tldr: This article examines regional and worldwide trends in energy consumption since World War II, focusing on the role of international oil trade and the impact of alternative energy sources in the United States. It discusses the growth of energy consumption, shifts in regional shares, and the decline of coal in favor of oil and gas. The author also analyzes the effect of an alternative supply path in the US and its potential impact on world energy demand and supply.
scientific_discipline: Energy and Resources > Energy Consumption and Projections
